name: Miss Kim Lilac
climate: Prefers a temperate climate with distinct seasonal changes.
Thrives in climates where winters are cold, and summers are mild.
Does best in areas with freezing temperatures during winter months.
Not suitable for tropical or persistent hot climates year-round.
sunlight: Requires full sunlight for at least six hours each day to thrive.
Benefits from morning sun and some afternoon shade in hotter areas.
Full sunlight helps in promoting vibrant bloom and healthy growth.
Insufficient sunlight may lead to poor flowering and less vigor.
watering: Water regularly during its first growing season to establish roots.
Requires consistent moisture but should not be left in soggy soil.
Once established, it is fairly drought-tolerant and needs less watering.
Water deeply but infrequently, allowing the soil to dry between waterings.
soil: Prefers well-drained soil with a slightly acidic to neutral pH level.
Avoid planting in heavy clay soils that retain too much water.
Amend the soil with organic matter for added nutrients and drainage.
Can tolerate a range of soil types as long as drainage is adequate.
extra_care_tip: Prune immediately after blooming to maintain shape and promote blooms.
Mulch around the base to retain moisture and suppress weeds effectively.
